module.name: wformat
module.short: Base class for formatted document writers

descr.p: The wformat unit provides the abstract base class TFormattingWriter for creating formatted document writers. This class defines a standard interface for generating formatted output in various formats like HTML, LaTeX, or plain text. Descendant classes implement the formatting methods for their specific output format.
TListType defines the types of lists that can be created using the TFormattingWriter class.

element.name: TlistType.ltOrdered
element.short: Ordered list with bullets or markers

element.name: TFormattingWriter
element.short: Abstract base class for formatted document writers

descr.p: TFormattingWriter is an abstract base class that defines the interface for creating formatted documents. It provides methods for document structure (headers, paragraphs), text formatting (bold, italic, underline), tables, and lists. Descendant classes implement the specific formatting for different output formats such as HTML, LaTeX, or plain text.
The class writes output to a stream provided during construction. Most methods are virtual and should be overridden by descendant classes to provide format-specific implementation.

element.name: TFormattingWriter.Create
element.short: Creates a new formatting writer instance

descr.p: Creates a new TFormattingWriter instance that will write output to the specified stream. The stream must be valid and remain available for the lifetime of the writer instance.

element.name: TFormattingWriter.EscapeText
element.short: Escapes text for the target format

descr.p: Virtual method that escapes special characters in text for the target output format. The base implementation returns the text unchanged. Descendant classes should override this method to escape format-specific characters.

element.name: TFormattingWriter.Dump
element.short: Writes raw text directly to the output stream

descr.p: Writes text directly to the output stream without any escaping or formatting. This is used for writing format-specific markup or pre-escaped text.

element.name: TFormattingWriter.Dump.AText
element.short: Raw text to write to stream

element.name: TFormattingWriter.DumpLn
element.short: Writes raw text followed by line ending to the output stream

descr.p: Writes text directly to the output stream followed by a line ending without any escaping or formatting. This is used for writing format-specific markup or pre-escaped text that should end with a new line.

element.name: TFormattingWriter.DumpLn.AText
element.short: Raw text to write to stream

element.name: TFormattingWriter.Write
element.short: Writes escaped text to the output stream

descr.p: Writes text to the output stream after passing it through EscapeText for proper formatting. This is the preferred method for writing user content that needs format-specific escaping.

element.name: TFormattingWriter.Write.AText
element.short: Text to be escaped and written

element.name: TFormattingWriter.WriteFmt
element.short: Writes formatted text using Format function

descr.p: Formats the text using the Format function and writes the result through Write. This provides a convenient way to write formatted text with proper escaping.
Virtual method that begins a new document with the specified title. Descendant classes should override this method to write format-specific document headers or initialization code.
Virtual method that ends the current document. Descendant classes should override this method to write format-specific document footers or cleanup code.

element.name: TFormattingWriter.Header
element.short: Writes a complete header at the specified level

descr.p: Writes a complete header by calling HeaderStart, writing the message text, and calling HeaderEnd. This is a convenience method for writing simple headers.

element.name: TFormattingWriter.Header.Alevel
element.short: Header level (1 for top level, higher numbers for subheaders)

element.name: TFormattingWriter.HeaderStart
element.short: Begins a header at the specified level

descr.p: Virtual method that begins header formatting at the specified level. Descendant classes should override this method to write format-specific header opening tags or formatting.

element.name: TFormattingWriter.HeaderStart.Alevel
element.short: Header level (1 for top level, higher numbers for subheaders)

element.name: TFormattingWriter.HeaderEnd
element.short: Ends a header at the specified level

descr.p: Virtual method that ends header formatting at the specified level. Descendant classes should override this method to write format-specific header closing tags or formatting.

element.name: TFormattingWriter.HeaderEnd.Alevel
element.short: Header level (1 for top level, higher numbers for subheaders)

Virtual method that ends paragraph formatting. Descendant classes should override this method to write format-specific paragraph closing tags or formatting.

Virtual method that inserts a horizontal rule or separator line in the output. Descendant classes should override this method to write format-specific rule markup.
Virtual method that begins bold text formatting. Descendant classes should override this method to write format-specific bold opening markup.
Virtual method that ends bold text formatting. Descendant classes should override this method to write format-specific bold closing markup.
Virtual method that begins italic text formatting. Descendant classes should override this method to write format-specific italic opening markup.

Virtual method that ends underlined text formatting. Descendant classes should override this method to write format-specific underline closing markup.

Virtual method that ends a preformatted text block. Descendant classes should override this method to write format-specific preformatted closing markup.

element.name: TFormattingWriter.TableStart
element.short: Begins a table with specified columns and border

descr.p: Virtual method that begins a table with the specified number of columns and optional border. Descendant classes should override this method to write format-specific table opening markup.

element.name: TFormattingWriter.TableStart.NoCols

element.name: TFormattingWriter.TableStart.Border
element.short: True to display table border, False otherwise

descr.p: Virtual method that ends the current table. Descendant classes should override this method to write format-specific table closing markup.
Virtual method that begins a new table row. Descendant classes should override this method to write format-specific row opening markup.
Virtual method that ends the current table row. Descendant classes should override this method to write format-specific row closing markup.

element.name: TFormattingWriter.RowNext
element.short: Moves to the next table row

descr.p: Convenience method that calls RowEnd followed by RowStart to move to the next table row.
Virtual method that begins a new table cell. Descendant classes should override this method to write format-specific cell opening markup.
Virtual method that ends the current table cell. Descendant classes should override this method to write format-specific cell closing markup.

element.name: TFormattingWriter.CellNext
element.short: Moves to the next table cell

descr.p: Convenience method that calls CellEnd followed by CellStart to move to the next table cell.

element.name: TFormattingWriter.HeaderCellStart
element.short: Begins a new table header cell

descr.p: Virtual method that begins a new table header cell. Descendant classes should override this method to write format-specific header cell opening markup.

element.name: TFormattingWriter.HeaderCellEnd
element.short: Ends the current table header cell

element.name: TFormattingWriter.HeaderCellNext
element.short: Moves to the next table header cell

descr.p: Convenience method that calls HeaderCellEnd followed by HeaderCellStart to move to the next table header cell.

element.name: TFormattingWriter.ListStart
element.short: Begins a list of the specified type

element.name: TFormattingWriter.ListEnd
element.short: Ends a list of the specified type

descr.p: Virtual method that ends a list of the specified type. Descendant classes should override this method to write format-specific list closing markup.
Virtual method that begins a new list item. Descendant classes should override this method to write format-specific list item opening markup.

element.name: TFormattingWriter.ListItem

descr.p: Convenience method that creates a complete list item by calling ListItemStart, writing the text, and calling ListItemEnd.

element.name: TFormattingWriter.ListItem.AText
element.short: Text content for the list item

element.name: TFormattingWriter.DefinitionItem
element.short: Creates a definition list item with name and description

descr.p: Virtual method that creates a definition list item with a name and its description. Descendant classes should override this method to write format-specific definition item markup.

element.name: TFormattingWriter.WriteList
element.short: Writes a complete list from string list

descr.p: Convenience method that writes a complete list from a TStrings object. For definition lists, strings should contain name=value pairs where the name is separated from the value by an equals sign.
LineFeed is a constant that contains the platform-specific line ending character sequence. It is defined as LineEnding and is used by DumpLn for consistent line breaks across platforms.
